[http://www.american.edu/ american.edu] |publictransit = Tenleytown-AU
(Washington Metro) }} 'American University' ('AU' or 'American') is a private
liberal arts and research university in Washington, D.C.,
United States, affiliated with the United Methodist Church. The university was chartered by an Act of Congress on
February 24, 1893 as "The American University," when the bill was approved by
President Benjamin Harrison. [http://www1.american.edu/trustees/charter.html
:: AU : Board of Trustees]. .american.edu. Retrieved on 2011-11-
22. [http://www1.american.edu/president/doc/Bylaws.pdf Bylaws and act
of incorporation]. American University. November 2004 Roughly 6,000
undergraduate students and 3,912 graduate students are currently enrolled. -
[http://apps.collegeboard.com/search/CollegeDetail.jsp?collegeId=393 College
Board American University Profile]. Retrieved March 19, 2008. AU is a
member of the Consortium of Universities of the Washington Metropolitan Area. A
member of the Division I Patriot League, its sports teams compete as the
American University Eagles. AU's 84-acre campus is designated as a national
arboretum and public garden that has a rich botanical history.

American's main campus is located at the intersection of Nebraska and
Massachusetts Avenues at Ward Circle in the Spring Valley neighborhood of
Northwest Washington. The area is served by the Tenleytown-AU station on the
Washington Metro subway line in the nearby neighborhood of Tenleytown.
